resources.string: Track with Diabuddy, trek with confidence in your Diabetes journey.
70–79% of readings in OK range in a day
80–89% of readings in OK range in a day
90–99% of readings in OK range in a day
100% of readings in OK range in a day
Filled up notes for all entries in a day
Checked the nutrition information of a food on Diabuddy
This is the number of days when 70–79% of your readings have been in your target range! Getting there!
This is the number of days when 80–89% of your readings have been in your target range! Keep it up!
This is the number of days when 90–99% of your readings have been in your target range! Fantastic job!
This is the number of days when 100% of your readings have been in your target range! Perfect!

This is the number of times that you have downloaded your Diabuddy data! Analysing your past data is extremely useful in identifying certain areas you may have to work on. For example, if you tend to have hypers at a certain time of the day, you could consider modifying your boluses or basal. Do consult your doctor on such modifications (and show them your downloaded data) if you are unsure!

This is the number of days when you took notes in every logbook entry! Taking notes will help you remember what you did right or wrong, or provide specific information about activities, stress or illness that could affect your sugars. This can help you better understand what happens to your sugars under different conditions, making it easier to manage them in the future :D

This is the number of times that you have searched for a food in your Nutrition tab. Doing this gives you an estimate of the amount of carbohydrates in a certain food item, which can help you count the amount of carbs in your meal and make sure you bolus enough!

Do you have any feedback, questions or suggestions for the developer of Diabuddy? Feel free to use this page to send an email to the developer of this app to ask questions or provide feedback / suggestions!
Click the + button to add a new food item to the list. Click on an existing food item to edit its details.
This name has been used before. Please use a different food name.
This name has been used before. Please use a different meal name.
Click the + button to add a new meal to the list. Click on an existing meal to edit its details.
Select a food item and click the button to add it to the meal. Remove food items from the meal using the button in the same row.
Invalid query! Please only include alphanumeric characters and spaces in your query. Do not include special characters and do not leave the text field empty. Please try again.
Click the + button to add a new logbook entry!
Note: if this entry is being edited on multiple devices at once, only the version that is saved later will be saved! Please ensure you are connected to the Internet before saving.
No entries found. Click the + button to add a new entry!
No food items added yet. Click the + button to add a new food item!
No meals added yet. Click the + button to add a new meal!
No search results found. Search for a type of food using the search bar above!
Note: The values stated are for 100 grams of the food product.\nClick on a search result to view its nutrition information and add it to your food template!
Diabuddy (Version 1.1) was created by a Type 1 diabetic to help other diabetics! Feel free to let the developer know of any features you wish to see:
This app uses the Edamam Food Search API. Many thanks to NUS High School of Mathematics & Science for making this project possible.
Permission to write to device files is required to download data.
Hi, I\'m your personal helper in your diabetes journey! I can answer your questions, give tips, give you reminders and more! I\'ll always be here and ready to help you :)
No messages sent or received yet. Click the + button to send a message!
Hey Diabuddy, do you have any diabetes management tips to share?
Hey Diabuddy, I\'ve been feeling discouraged regarding diabetes recently… do you have any advice?
Please enter a whole number between 1 and 1440. Your reminder can only be set at most one day in advance.
You set a reminder on Diabuddy earlier today.
Hey there! You asked me to remind you to do something at this time, so here\'s a reminder! :)
You seem to have had a severe hypo! View your Diabuddy\'s new message for a tip!
You seem to have had a severe hyper! View your Diabuddy\'s new message for a tip!
You seem to be having frequent hypos! View your Diabuddy\'s new message for a tip!
You seem to be having frequent hypers! View your Diabuddy\'s new message for a tip!
Note: your reminder will be deleted after your phone is powered off/restarted!
Please ensure you are connected to the Internet before editing. Your changes on this page will automatically be saved.
Would you like to save your changes before leaving this page?
Please make sure you are connected to the Internet while using the app! Otherwise, you will not be able to log in and/or your edits will not be saved.
Let\'s get started with some basic information…
What unit do you prefer using for blood glucose?
Hypo threshold: what is the minimum blood glucose level in your target range?
Hyper threshold: what is the maximum blood glucose level in your target range?
You can edit your hypo and hyper thresholds (and other optional information) anytime under Settings in the app bar later. However, you cannot change your blood glucose unit.
Use the logbook to log your blood glucose readings, insulin intake, food intake, exercise and more! Your Diabuddy will help you highlight key statistics in the data.

Your Diabuddy can help you search for nutrition information and add your favourite foods to your food template! The template tracks the carbohydrate contents of your favourite foods, making carb-counting easier.

Have a burning question, want some tips and advice or just need some emotional support? Fret not, your Diabuddy is here to help! Your Diabuddy can also send reminders, such as for post-meal blood glucose checks.

Your Diabuddy keeps track of milestones that you\'ve reached and how many times you\'ve reached them! The colour of each milestone progresses from red to green the more times you achieve it. Good luck!
Click below to watch how to add a logbook entry:
Click on a challenge to see its description!
List of food items cannot be empty! Please add a food item and try again.
Meal name cannot be empty! Please give this meal a name and try again.
Amount of carbs cannot be empty! Please input the carbohydrate content of this food item and try again.
Food item name cannot be empty! Please give this food item a name and try again.
Note: you will not be able to change your blood glucose unit after this point!
Note: you can click on the numbers below to edit them.

Diabuddy can help to keep track of foods that you eat regularly along with their carbohydrate content to help make your carb-counting easier! You can add various food items and group these food items into meals, which can be added directly to your logbook.

Diabuddy can help you keep track of your insulin injection (or insulin pump) sites! It is good to avoid injecting the same spots too frequently, as this may cause the skin to become lumpy and reduce the efficiency of insulin absorption. (Find out more about lipohypertrophy here!)
View and edit list of sites
Next injection site to be used:
Add and delete injection sites here! You can also reset the sites (mark all as unused) or mark individual sites as used or unused.
No injection sites added yet. Click the tools below and click the + button to add a new site!
Try to use a specific site name, e.g. \'2 finger widths to the right of belly button\', to avoid confusion between the different sites added.
Are you sure you want to delete all sites?
Are you sure you want to delete this site?
Are you sure you want to mark all sites as unused?
There is no unused injection site. Click the button below to edit and/or reset your sites!
Your next injection site should be:

We all have our favourite injection spots… but using them too often is unhealthy! Your Diabuddy can keep track of which injection sites you have used recently, making it more convenient for you to rotate injection sites.
If you are in portrait mode, rotate your phone to landscape mode and scroll down to see a larger graph. You can also pinch to zoom and use one finger to scroll.
The reading you said is in the wrong format! Please try again.
Note: at most 100 messages will be saved. Older messages will be automatically deleted.
Search for text that you have typed in your notes (not case-sensitive). For example, you can search for HbA1c readings if you have indicated them.
Not sure how to use Diabuddy?\nClick to read the app guide:
